page.title: 08Worten Home Farm,Great Chart
page.content: Mr.Jim Kerr farms 330 acres at Worten Home Farm.He has about 300 sheep which he keeps for their meat.He would like to have some cattle but they are not a paying proposition.The cereal crops, grown on his good land,are wheat, barley,rape and oats,and he also grows peas and beans on the poorer land.It is an extensive farm with three men to help and an extra one at pea harvest. He has three combines and six tractors.Most of his crops are grown for cash though some go for animal feed.His soil is a mixture of grade two and grade three.He has trouble with the River Stour flooding so he cannot grow crops in that area.He is not affected by recent changes in the area as he is some way from the housing estates and the by-pass.
